ACLED Notes: On 28 November 2022, suspected security operatives dressed in military uniforms shot the security officers (presumed Military forces) guarding an oil well in Izombe (Oguta, Imo). The assailants invaded the area in armored cars, there are no further details.

ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 3 December 2022, some naval officers clashed with policemen in Satellite town (Amowo-Odofin, Lagos) following an argument which ensued after the policemen on patrol duty flagged down the soldiers who were dressed in plain clothes. One policeman was stabbed and killed by the soldiers, many passers-by who attempted to intervene and an unspecified number of policemen were also wounded by the soldiers. The navy claimed that the policeman was not stabbed to death, and that it was the policemen and a mob who started hitting the soldiers before a policeman shot in the air and dispersed the crowd.

ACLED Notes: On 15 February 2023, soldiers from 174 battalion wounded an unspecified number of policemen and other persons when they attacked Ogigo police station (Shagamu, Ogun) and set it ablaze. The attack was a reprisal, for the murder of a soldier by a policeman who ran into the station [coded separately]. The military authorities claimed that the attack was carried out by a mob and not soldiers.

Another set of soldiers who were on the right lane also joined their colleagues to beat up the victims who were later hospitalized.

ACLED Notes: On 3 November 2022, soldiers on a search and rescue mission clashed with IPOB militants at Amangwu (Ohafia, Abia). The mission was targeted at the rescue of an off-duty soldier who was abducted by the militants [coded separately], according to the Defense Headquarters. One soldier was killed during the operations which lasted over some days [coded separately based on dates]. Other sources report that soldiers attacked civilians, killed 10, burnt 50 houses and over 100 residents were displaced while searching for the abductee; the Defense Headquarters denied the claims, IPOB denied having camps in the said areas and involvement in the abduction and clashes with soldiers, and claimed that armed groups in the areas where stated sponsored.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.

ACLED Notes: On 4 November 2022, soldiers on a search and rescue mission clashed with suspected IPOB militants at Okon Aku (Ohafia, Abia). One militant was killed, one rifle, ammunition and a mobile phone were recovered, according to the Defense Headquarters. One soldier was killed during the operations which lasted over some days [coded separately based on dates]. Other sources report that soldiers attacked civilians, killed 10, burnt 50 houses and over 100 residents were displaced while searching for the abductee; the Defense Headquarters denied the claims, IPOB denied having camps in the said areas and involvement in the abduction and clashes with soldiers, and claimed that armed groups in the areas where stated sponsored.

Two militants were killed, some fled with gunshot wounds, weapons, ammunition and other items were recovered, according to the Defense Headquarters. One soldier was killed during the operations which lasted over some days [coded separately based on dates]. Other sources report that soldiers attacked civilians, killed 10, burnt 50 houses and over 100 residents were displaced while searching for the abductee; the Defense Headquarters denied the claims, IPOB denied having camps in the said areas and involvement in the abduction and clashes with soldiers, and claimed that armed groups in the areas where stated sponsored.

The militants were pursued by the policemen; two militants were killed, a couple of policemen sustained minor injuries, one militant commander was arrested and the others fled with bullet wounds and a bomb factory was uncovered. IPOB denied any connection with the bomb factory and insisted that the police and its agents of being responsible.

ACLED Notes: On 30 October 2022, Nigerian troops of Operation Forest Sanity conducted clearance patrol and clashed with a Kaduna militia at Kagi Hill, Maidaro, Kusharki and Ungwan Madaki (Giwa, Kaduna). Four militiamen were killed and others fled, weapons, ammunition and motorcycles were recovered by the troops. Fatalities split accross 4 events.

ACLED Notes: On 23 December 2022, troops of Operation Forest Sanity clashed with Kaduna militias when they conducted clearance operations on different militia camps in Damba (Chikun, Kaduna), Tudun Quardo, Tsibiri, Bwashishi and Gwagwada [coded separately] villages. One militia member was killed; the camps were destroyed, arms, ammunition and other items were recovered. One fatality split accross 4 events, coded as 1.

ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 18 December 2022, troops of Operation Forest Sanity on an offensive clashed with a Kaduna militia at their camp in Kidandan (Giwa, Kaduna). Two militiamen were killed; one rifle, ammunition, five motorcycles and three mobile phones were recovered by the troops.

ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 6 December 2022, Nigerian army soldiers on clearance patrol clashed with a Kaduna militia at Idasu (Giwa, Kaduna), Fatika and Makera [coded separately]. Several militiamen were killed, coded as 3 and others fled to the Hayin Siddi area.

ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 23 December 2022, troops of Operation Forest Sanity on an ambush patrol clashed with a Kaduna militia at Buruku (Chikun, Kaduna), Birnin Gwari general area and Giwa LGA [coded separately]. 8 militiamen were killed; split across two events and coded as 4, four motorcycles and three mobile phones were recovered.

ACLED Notes: On 30 December 2022, Nigerian troops on a clearance operation clashed with a Niger militia at Chimbi (Gurara, Niger). 13 abductees were rescued, some of the militiamen were wounded and the others fled.

ACLED Notes: On 21 October 2022, soldiers, policemen and a local self defense militia invaded militia camps and clashed with a Zamfara militia in Gando forest (Maru, Zamfara). 27 abductees were rescued, casualties are unknown.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 20 October 2022, troops of Operation Hadarin Daji who were on a fighting patrol clashed with a Zamfara militia at Dorca village (Anka, Zamfara). Two militiamen including Ibrahim Chire who was a militia leader were killed, others fled with injuries. One rifle, 4 rounds of ammunition, one motorcycle and mobile phones were recovered.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 2 February 2023, troops of 1 Division of the Nigerian army on a fighting patrol clashed with a Kaduna militia at Manini village (Chikun, Kaduna). 30 abductees were rescued by the troops who also recovered two motorcycles, casualties are unknown.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 3 January 2023, Nigerian troops carried out an ambush operation against a Kaduna militia and engaged them in an armed clash at Rafin Taba (Giwa, Kaduna). Two militiamen were killed, two rifles, ammunition, money and other items were recovered by the troops.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 12 January 2023, the Nigerian police clashed with Niger Communal Militia in Maje Village, coded to Nasko (Magama, Niger). The police shot and killed one of the militia members and recovered his AK-49 rifle. Others escaped with gun wounds. 1 fatality reported.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 12 January 2023, the Nigerian police clashed with Niger Communal militia in New Bussa (Borgu, Niger). The militiamen were trying to collect a ransom to release some hostages in their captivity when the police engaged them. The police killed three militiamen and freed the hostages unharmed. They also recovered one pump action rifle with four cartridges and two single-barrel guns. 3 fatalities reported.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 19 December 2022, Nigerian troops comprised of the army and the air force clashed with Zamfara militia from more than five camps led by Damina, Ali Kachalla, Buzu and Ado Aliero who reinforced for a reprisal attack at Malele community (Maru, Zamfara). The militiamen fled into Mutumji community and blended with residents while trying to escape airstrikes [coded separately]; at least 63 residents, 180 militiamen and 10 to 13 soldiers were killed. An unspecified number of soldiers, 73 civilians were wounded, 3 military vehicles, several houses, vehicles and motorcycles were burnt. The operation lasted from 17-19 December, the military claimed that 40 militiamen were killed, a few civilians were wounded and soldier was wounded in an ambush, [lowest estimate of] 40 fatalities split across 6 events coded as 5.
ACLED Source: Daily Leadership (Nigeria); Daily Post (Nigeria); Daily Trust (Nigeria); Sahara Reporters

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.

ACLED Notes: On 2 February 2023, soldiers beat up security officers on night duty at the main campus of the University of Benin at Ugbowo (Egor, Edo) after they scaled the perimeter fence to gain entrance. The attack was a reprisal following a clash between the soldiers and students earlier [coded separately]; scores of civilians including students were wounded and several vehicles on the campus were destroyed.

ACLED Notes: On 2 December 2022, ISWAP claimed to have clashed with a patrol of soldiers that attacked their position in Malam Fatori (Abadan, Borno). One soldier was killed, the others fled.

ACLED Notes: On 9 November 2022, ISWAP claimed to have attacked a camp of Nigerian and Cameroonian troops and engaged them in an armed clash at Wulgo (Ngala, Borno). Three soldiers were killed, one medium machine gun and a rifle were seized by the militants.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 21 December 2022, an unidentified armed group ambushed policemen who were on a routine patrol and engaged them in an armed clash in Lokoja (Lokoja, Kogi). Two policemen were killed and the assailants fled before reinforcement arrived. ISWAP claimed to have attacked the policemen at a checkpoint, killed 4 of them and set their vehicles ablaze.

ACLED Notes: On 23 November 2022, troops of Operation Hadin Kai repelled an attack by ISWAP militants on Goniri (Gujba, Yobe) until they fled. There are no further details.

ACLED Notes: On 21 January 2023, presumed ISWAP/ Boko Haram militants ambushed Nigerian military forces that were escorting a civilian convoy at Nyaleri village (Damboa, Borno). The troops engaged the militants in an armed clash until they fled, casualties are unknown.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 13 January 2023, the Islamic State fighters attacked the Nigerian Army headquarters in Azare (Hawul, Borno). IS claimed to have killed and wounded many soldiers and destroyed an armoured vehicle. The also seized some weapons and ammunition from the Nigerian troops. Unknown casualties coded as 3.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 19 January 2023, IPOB militants clashed with policemen when they attempted to attack the Njaba divisional police headquarters in Umuaka (Njaba, Imo). The police repelled the attack, one of the militants was killed, an unspecified number of others were shot and wounded and weapons were recovered.

ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 18 November 2022, ISWAP or Boko Haram fighters clashed with the police and military forces near Malam Fatori (Abadan, Borno). 11 fatalities, including 9 soldiers and 2 mobile police officers were recorded.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 10 December 2022, suspected IPOB militants numbering over 10 from a faction led by Simon Ekpa who were enforcing a sit in order clashed with policemen at New Market in Enugu (Enugu North, Enugu). A police van was set ablaze by the assailants, one source report that a pregnant woman was killed by a stray bullet.
ACLED Source: Daily Independent (Nigeria); Daily Trust (Nigeria); Nigeria Punch

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 27 October 2022, six suspected IPOB militants attacked policemen who were on a stop and search duty and engaged them in an armed clash in Orlu (Orlu, Imo). One of the assailants was killed, guns, several rounds of ammunition and the car used in the attack which the police claim was stolen, were recovered.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 12 December 2022, IPOB militants in their numbers attacked INEC headquarters and were repelled by policemen in Owerri (Owerri Municipal, Imo). The assailants bombed the building; leaving a part of it and some vehicles destroyed, 3 assailants and 1 policeman were killed, 2 others were arrested and one policeman was wounded while the police recovered several guns, ammunition and charms. The state governor claimed that desperate politicians in the state were behind the attack.
ACLED Source: Blueprint; Daily Champion; Daily Post (Nigeria); Premium Times (Nigeria)

ACLED Notes: On 29 October 2022, Boko Haram/ ISWAP fighters in large numbers were engaged in an armed clash with soldiers when they attempted to invade the military barracks of Wawa cantonment, New Bussa (Borgu, Niger) and free militants that were in detention there. The soldiers received reinforcement from the air force base in the area and repelled the militants; 8 militants were killed, 3 to 18 others were arrested and an unspecified number were wounded.
ACLED Source: Nigeria Punch; Daily Independent (Nigeria); HumAngle; Blueprint; Daily Post (Nigeria); CKN Nigeria; Daily Trust (Nigeria)

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 19 February 2023, IPOB/ ESN militants engaged policemen in an armed clash at 3-3 divisional headquarters in Nkwelle Ezunaka (Oyi, Anambra). Six militants were killed, others fled with gunshot wounds and one policeman was fatally wounded, other sources report the assailants were five in number and 1 policeman were all killed. An office within the facility was partially destroyed with petrol by the militants who also set a vehicle ablaze; two rifles, one vehicle, charms and other items were recovered by the police, other sources report that the assailants were killed by soldiers who responded to the attack.
ACLED Source: Daily Independent (Nigeria); Daily Post (Nigeria); Daily Trust (Nigeria); Premium Times (Nigeria)

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 23 February 2023, suspected IPOB militants killed a security operative and one civilian in Ugbolu town (Oshimili North, Delta). The militants shot sporadically insisted that there would be no election, the bodies were found the following morning; the security operative was beheaded and burnt, while the civilian was stabbed to death. The spokesperson of the police in the state claimed that one person was killed.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 21 October 2022, ISWAP fighters led by Bako Gogore attacked a formation of Nigerian troops at Waijroko (Damboa, Borno). There are no further details.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 29 December 2022, ISWAP militants were repelled by Nigerian troops when they attempted to invade Mangada (Biu, Borno). Casualties unknown.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.

ACLED Notes: On 26 December 2022, troops of Operation Hadin Kai repelled an attack by Boko Haram [JAS] fighters in Gwoza (Gwoza, Borno). Casualties unknown.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 17 October 2022, Nigerian troops repelled an attack by scores of ISWAP militants on Mafa town (Mafa, Borno). The militants who invaded the area in gun trucks and motorcycles, attempted to attack the town through Charly Papa 1 and fled after the troops engaged them. There were no casualties from the troops, unknown militant fatalities coded as 3. ISWAP claimed the attack and said a military checkpoint was attacked, the garrison was driven away and ammunition was taken away.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 23 January 2023, troops of Operation Hadin Kai repelled an attack by ISWAP fighters in Mafa (Mafa, Borno). The militants fired a few shots and fled after the troops responded. Casualties are unknown.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 13 February 2023, ISWAP militants clashed with Nigerian troops when they attacked a checkpoint on the outskirts of Damboa (Damboa, Borno). The militants fled and also claimed to have targeted and fired a 40mm grenade launcher at a camp of the Nigerian army. Casualties are unknown.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 22 February 2023, troops of 3 battalion, 22 task force brigade clashed with ISWAP militants and repelled their attempt to attack Gamboru (Ngala, Borno). Some militants were killed, while the rest fled. Fatalities coded as 3.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 10 November 2022, Nigerian troops clashed with ISWAP fighters who invaded a humanitarian transport hub in Monguno (Monguno, Borno) and attempted to steal vehicles. The militants were repelled, they set vehicles ablaze before they fled. ISWAP claimed the attack was at the ICRC compound and that 25 vehicles were set ablaze. Other sources report that the attack was at a transportation agency and 22 vehicles were destroyed.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 6 November 2022, policemen repelled an attack by ISWAP fighters on a police divisional command in Magumeri (Magumeri, Borno). The assailants invaded the town in a convoy of gun trucks; fled with one police patrol vehicle and set one policeman's private car ablaze, one policeman sustained gunshot wounds and was killed as a result. ISWAP claimed the attack and the killing of two policemen.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 2 December 2022, Nigerian troops engaged ISWAP militants in an armed clash after the militants invaded Waijroko (Damboa, Borno) in two MRAPs, six Hilux vehicles mounted with anti aircraft guns and fired multiple mortar bombs from the Gubub axis of the town. The troops also ambushed the militants who were fleeing, scores of militants were killed, coded as 20 in the gun battle which lasted for about 40 minutes.

ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 13 January 2023, ISWAP attacked the Nigerian troops of 25 brigades of Operation Hadin Kai in Azir OR Ajir (Damboa, Borno) with three mine-resistant ambush-protected (MRAP) vehicles and four gun trucks. The troops, supported by air components, repelled the attack and engaged the militia in a heavy gun battle that killed many ISWAP fighters. Unknown casualties codes as 3.

ACLED Notes: On 20 October 2022, the Nigeria Defense Headquarters claimed that IPOB militants attacked soldiers who were on duty and engaged them in an armed clash at Isuofia (Aguata, Anambra). The attack was repelled, one of the assailants was arrested by the troops who also recovered guns and ammunition.

The clash started on 12 February [coded separately]; eight people were killed and seven houses were burnt, 10 persons were arrested in connection with the clash, 8 fatalities split across 3 events coded as 2.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 12 February 2023, Black Axe (also called Aiye Confraternity) and Red Axe militias clashed in Gboko (Gboko, Benue) following a disagreement by some party supporters after a political rally over the money to be shared among them. The clash lasted for three days [coded separately], eight people were killed and seven houses were burnt, 8 fatalities split across 3 events coded as 3.

The clash started the previous day and lasted till the next [coded separately]; eight people were killed and seven houses were burnt, 6 persons were arrested in connection with the clash, 8 fatalities split across 3 events coded as 3.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 28 January 2023, a member of Ebube Agu corps killed his colleague in Isu (Onicha, Ebonyi) following a disagreement over 1000 naira and the sharing formula of money given to them during a campaign rally of the All Progressives Congress. The victim had attempted to shoot the assailant first but the assailant was quicker to act. Other sources report that the altercation was over other reasons while the state Ebube Agu commander claimed that the assailant was not a member of the corps but a member of an unidentified armed group.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.

The clash escalated towards Ajangbadi and several persons were wounded.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 11 February 2023, Eiye confraternity clashed with Black axe militia (also called Aiye confraternity) at Ijanikin (Ojo, Lagos) when the Eiye members invaded the home of the leader of the Aiye killer squad. The targeted Aiye member was not around, his brother was macheted and severely injured while two other militia members were killed.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 24 January 2023, PDP and APC supporters clashed in Ikire (Isokan, Osun) after the parties' senatorial candidates for Osun West senatorial district set their campaign rallies on the same day. The APC candidate claimed that the assailants were led by his PDP opponent, the PDP candidate claimed that two of his supporters were killed and others were wounded, the police confirmed the clash and one fatality and that some others were wounded.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.

One member of the group was killed, four escaped with gunshot wounds and two were arrested. One rifle was recovered and handed over to the police alongside the arrested persons.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.

The Deeebam ambushed and killed the leader of the Icelanders and proceeded to a house where their second target was suspected of hiding. As they didn't meet their target at home, they set the house on fire leading to the death of an aged woman (coded separately). 2 fatalities shared across two events. 1 fatality reported.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.

The assailants had attempted to attack the chairman who fled to Abakaliki. Other sources report that the attack was related to the annulment of a youth group election in the area after the chairman raised concerns that the newly elected officials were loyalists of the former council chairman.

One of the assailants was arrested by the Civilian JTF.

ACLED Notes: On 3 February 2023, a Katsina militia clashed with Yansakai militia from 11 villages who trailed them to a location at Yargoje forest (Kankara, Katsina) and attempted to recover cattle that were stolen by the Katsina militia [coded separately]. Some sources report that the clash lasted for over 48 hours; 41 Yansakai militiamen were killed; and later increased to between 72 and 102, two others were wounded, other sources report unspecified number of wounded persons. 72 fatalities split across two events coded as 36.

The affected buildings included the Local Government headquarters and the Independent Electoral Commission's (INEC) building. 4 fatalities reported.

Other sources report more than one of the assailants were killed, including the militia leader Kachalla Gudau and his aide Rigimamme. One rifle, ammunition and locally made grenades were recovered by the troops.

The ground forces, including the police, supported the air operation by blocking the roads leading to the LGAs and conducting house-to-house searches to prevent the militias from fleeing the assault. Casualties unknown.

The militia leader and an unspecified number of his followers were killed, other sources report that militiamen on motorcycles were trailed and killed after the air strike, and 8 militiamen including Yellow Kano were killed in the air strike. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

ACLED Notes: On 21 October 2022, the air component of Operation Hadarin Daji carried out an air strike targeted at a Zamfara militia led by Halilu Buzu at Sububu (Maradun, Zamfara) where the militia leader and his followers were scheduled to meet. The leader and an unspecified number of militiamen were killed and their logistics base where weapons and ammunition were stored was also destroyed. Other sources report that other militia leaders and their followers numbering up to 7 were also killed. Fatalities coded as 8.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Air or drone strikes that have occurred in the absence of any other engagement; includes any air-to-ground attacks that do not involve exchange of fire with ground forces.

ACLED Notes: On 24 January 2023, a Nigerian Air Force fighter jet carried out airstrikes on a patrol of a joint task force operatives, comprised a local defense militia in Galkogo (Shiroro, Niger) and killed an unspecified number of persons while several others were also wounded. Some sources report that the joint task force were mistaken for a Niger militia, other report that the attack was a result of dynamite explosion planted by a Niger militia and that 21 - 30 persons were killed, some were critically wounded and others were missing. Civilians in the area fled to safety.
ACLED Source: Nigeria Punch; Premium Times (Nigeria); Sahara Reporters; The Cable (Nigeria)

Other sources report that the rioters beat up many commercial motorcyclists that were operating in the town, and blocked the convoy of the police commissioner before they were dispersed by policemen. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Significant changes in the activity or structure of armed groups. This can include the creation of a new armed divisions, recruitment drives, movement of forces or any other non-violent security measures enacted by armed actors.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: This event type captures contextually important information regarding the activities of violent groups that is not itself recorded as political violence, yet may trigger future events or contribute to political dynamics within and across states.
ACLED Notes: Security measures: On 15 January 2023, the Niger State Government imposed a dusk-to-down curfew in the Lambata community, Lambata (Gurara, Niger). The curfew was imposed to restore peace and douse the tension arising from the killing of the District head by some communal militia, coded separately.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: An organized armed group engages in looting or seizing goods or property other than weapons or weapon.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: This event type captures contextually important information regarding the activities of violent groups that is not itself recorded as political violence, yet may trigger future events or contribute to political dynamics within and across states.
ACLED Notes: Property destruction: On 23 December 2022, troops of Operation Whirl Stroke raided the hideout of an unidentified armed group and recovered some items at Udei (Guma, Benue). The group fled when they sighted the troops, the items that were recovered included military and police uniforms.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: State forces or other actors exercising de facto control detain a particularly significant individual or engage in mass arrests.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: This event type captures contextually important information regarding the activities of violent groups that is not itself recorded as political violence, yet may trigger future events or contribute to political dynamics within and across states.
ACLED Notes: On 30 January 2023, the police arrested 29 members of Black Axe and Red Axe cult militias in Ikpayongo (Gwer East, Benue) following a clash between them the previous day which led to the death of one person [coded separately].

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: State forces or other actors exercising de facto control detain a particularly significant individual or engage in mass arrests.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: This event type captures contextually important information regarding the activities of violent groups that is not itself recorded as political violence, yet may trigger future events or contribute to political dynamics within and across states.
ACLED Notes: On 9 February 2023, policemen arrested 53 suspected members of an unidentified armed group at a PDP rally in Kano (Kano Municipal, Kano) as claimed by the state police command. Two locally made guns, 32 knives, one axe, two catapults and a bunch of charms were recovered from them by the police.

ACLED Notes: On 14 October 2022, an unidentified armed group attacked the PDP gubernatorial candidate and his supporters as they were entering Gusau (Gusau, Zamfara). The PDP claimed that the assailants were sponsored by the state government, and that 18 environmental workers were attacked, one of whom was killed. ACLED Notes: On 30 October 2022, a Katsina militia abducted 39 children when they invaded a farm in Kamanji village, also called Mairuwa (Faskari, Katsina). The children were working as harvesters together with adults who were able to escape. Some sources report that over 40 farmers including 21 children were abducted, others report that the attack was because abductors were offended that the farm manager did not pay the complete protection money they had demanded before harvest began on the farm, a ransom of 30 million naira was demanded, a total of 1,550,000 was paid and the abductees were released.
ACLED Source: Daily Post (Nigeria); Nigeria Punch; Sun (Nigeria); Daily Trust (Nigeria)

ACLED Notes: On 19 January 2023, suspected Fulani herdsmen shot and killed eight persons in the Abagana community, Makurdi (Makurdi, Benue). The victims, including a family of six members, were wiped out in the attack. Another source reported that some victims were beheaded, and the assailants went away with their heads. Two victims were IDPs, as the community is opposite the IDP camp. 8 fatalities reported.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The targeting of civilians with any violence by an organised armed actor. Attacks of sexual nature are coded as ‘Sexual violence’.

ACLED Notes: On 7 February 2023, Amasiri and Nde Ndukwe attacked farm settlements in Oso (Afikpo South, Ebonyi) and killed one person during the attacks which started the previous day and lasted for 3 days before the intervention of security operatives. Houses, farm produce and properties were destroyed, four others were abducted and later released after a peace meeting organized by council chairmen and monarchs. The murdered victim was behead, his head was taken away by the assailants. Fatality split across 3 events, coded as 0.

Houses, farm produce and properties were destroyed, four others were abducted and later released after a peace meeting organized by council chairmen and monarchs. ACLED Notes: On 7 January 2023, an armed group suspected to be Fulani heardsmen attacked the Igueben Train Station in Igueben (Igueben, Edo) and abducted 31 passengers waiting to board a train. The assailants, armed with AK-47 rifles, invaded the train station, shot sporadically, and some passengers sustained bullet wounds before marching them into the bush. The police and the vigilante group later rescued five victims, including a retired police officer, a lady and three kids.

ACLED Notes: On 8 January 2023, Fulani herders attacked and killed a farmer in Eshijiko, Pada or Kpada (Pategi, Kwara) during an altercation. The altercation ensued when the farmer met some cows on his farm and asked the herders to drive them away. The killing provoked a reprisal attack that burnt many Fulani settlements, coded separately. 1 fatality reported.

ACLED Notes: On 15 January 2023, Niger Communal Militia attacked a Reverend Father of Saint Peter and Paul Catholic Church in his house in Kafin Koro (Paikoro, Niger). The militiamen set the house on fire and burnt the Reverend Father alive when they couldn't access his house. A colleague of the father was shot in the shoulder when trying to escape from the scene. It was reported that the militia members divided themselves into two; a group went to the father's residence, and the other stood guard in town to prevent interference. 1 fatality reported.

Three other victims drowned while trying to escape, the assailants demanded for money, gold and other items from the miners and shot 3 persons who were uncooperative.

About 25 others were wounded, the victims included women and children, houses were destroyed and the murdered victims had their throats slit and machete cuts on their heads, 5 more bodies were found the following day, 5 fatalities split across 2 events coded as 3.

Some sources report that the attack was politically motivated, others report that the victim was a ward chairman of the APC, the attack had no political undertone and the assailants invaded the area in a convoy of 16 motorcycles and conducted a house to house search for livestock.

ACLED Notes: On 1 December 2022, policemen guarding an INEC office repelled suspected IPOB militants that attempted to burn the office in Orlu (Orlu, Imo). The assailants invaded the area, shot sporadically and threw an IED which damaged the security post of the office before they were chased by the policemen. The police claimed that many of the assailants sustained serious wounds. IPOB denied any links to the attack and claimed that the government and police were trying to blackmail it by linking the groups with attacks.
ACLED Source: Daily Independent (Nigeria); Daily Post (Nigeria); Premium Times (Nigeria); Sun (Nigeria)

ACLED Notes: On 24 November 2022, an unidentified armed group dressed in military uniform clashed with policemen who were on escort duty at Rumuokoro (Obio, Rivers). Three policemen were killed, others sources report four policemen killed, valuables were stolen by the assailants who also abducted an oil and gas executive. The abductee was released around 8 December, there are no reports about ransom payment.
ACLED Source: Daily Post (Nigeria); Daily Trust (Nigeria); Nigeria Punch; Vanguard (Nigeria)

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 2 February 2023, an unidentified armed group invaded a police anti-cult unit and were engaged in an armed clash by policemen on duty at Obosi (Idemili South, Anambra). The assailants who threw petrol bombs into the police station were repelled, one policeman was killed, some were fatally wounded and the assailants' bombs destroyed some building in the station.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 2 February 2023, suspected Ebube Agu operatives ambushed the convoy of the APGA gubernatorial candidate, wounded his police orderly who later died and two others at Okpoto (Ishielu, Ebonyi). The driver of the APGA candidate was killed, his backup Hilux van was set ablaze and at least five persons were missing. The state commander of Ebube Agu denied the attack.
ACLED Source: Blueprint; Daily Independent (Nigeria); Daily Post (Nigeria); Sahara Reporters

ACLED Notes: On 27 December 2022, Eiye confraternity members killed a member of rival Aiye cult, also known as Black Axe at Igbede (Ojo, Lagos). The victim was shot and butchered by the assailants.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 15 January 2023, the Eiye cult militia and Aro Bagger or Arobaga clashed around the Ekosodin Area of Benin City (Oredo, Edo) and killed four militiamen from both sides. The clash broke out when the Aro Bagger mistakenly shot and killed an Eiye member over a conflicting issue between them and the Black Axe. 4 fatalities reported.

ACLED Ally Actor2: Fulani Ethnic Group (Nigeria); Pastoralists (Nigeria); Labour Group (Nigeria)
ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Remote- or victim-activated devices detonated in the absence of any other engagement; includes landmines, improvised explosive devices (IEDs) and unexploded ordinances (UXO).
ACLED Event TypeDesc: One-sided violent events in which the tool for engaging in conflict creates asymmetry by taking away the ability of the target to respond.
ACLED Notes: On 24 January 2023, a suspected unidentified armed group detonated an explosive device on Fulani pastoralists and butchers at Rukubi community (Doma, Nassarawa) as they were returning from Benue state. Some sources report that the explosion resulted from a NAF air strike; others report that it a Tiv ethnic militia attacked the victims and stole their cows, one victim claimed that it was not clear whether it was an airstrike, a bomb or explosive devices attached to the vehicle that conveyed the cows, the state governor claimed it was an unidentified drone that dropped a bomb on the victims. Between 27 to 40 fatalities which later increased to 56 was reported.
ACLED Source: Blueprint; Daily Trust (Nigeria); Nigeria Punch; Sahara Reporters

ACLED Ally Actor2: Amotekun Corps; Police Forces of Nigeria (2015-); Police Forces of Nigeria (2015-) NSCDC: Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps
ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: An attempt to disperse or suppress peaceful protest without serious/lethal injuries being reported or the targeting of protesters with lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A protest is defined as a public demonstration in which the participants do not engage in violence, though violence may be used against them.
ACLED Notes: On 6 February 2023, scores of protesters comprised of youths and students blocked the entrance of the University of Ibadan (Akinyele, Oyo) and protested over the scarcity of naira notes. The protesters were dispersed by security operatives made up of soldiers, NSCDC operatives, policemen and Amotekun Corps. [size=scores]

ACLED Ally Actor2: APC: All Progressives Congress; PDP: People's Democratic Party
ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: An organized armed group engages in looting or seizing goods or property other than weapons or weapon.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: This event type captures contextually important information regarding the activities of violent groups that is not itself recorded as political violence, yet may trigger future events or contribute to political dynamics within and across states.
ACLED Notes: Property destruction: On 18 December 2022, an unidentified armed group destroyed the campaign billboards and posters of the Ogun state chapter of the APC and the PDP in Abeokuta (Abeokuta South, Ogun). The destruction spanned about two and a half kilometers; from Abeokuta-Sagamu expressway to Oke Mosan.

The abductee was released on 4 December, there are no reports about ransom payment.

The pupils were kidnapped as they arrived at the school premises early in the morning. Two female pupils among the abductees were rescued around 21 January, in Obi LGA after pressure was mounted on the abductors; the remaining four abductees were rescued around 3 February, there are no details on ransom payment.

One of the abductees escaped, the decomposing bodies of the other 7 were found [coded separately]

ACLED Notes: On 1 December 2022, an unidentified armed group attacked the residence of Oso Adowa-Akoko traditional ruler in Ajowa-Akoko (Akoko North West, Ondo). The assailants shot sporadically when they invaded the residence and destroyed the main entrance into the residential building of the palace, and kidnapped the traditional ruler. A ransom of 100 million naira was demanded, it was later reduced to 10 million and the abductee was released around 8 December after it was paid.

ACLED Notes: On 9 February 2023, a suspected unidentified cult militia shot and killed a student on the Calabar campus (Calabar Municipal, Cross River) of University of Cross River. They drove into the campus and drove straight to where the victim was, they covered his face with his shirt after he was shot twice and took his bag before they drove off. The reason for the attack is unknown, other sources report that the assailants were operatives of the joint task force backed by the state government which is comprised of soldier, policemen, DSS and NSCDC operatives.

ACLED Notes: On 9 February 2023, an unidentified armed group suspected to be assassins who were dressed in police uniforms shot at car of the Rivers state director-general of the PDP presidential campaign in Port Harcourt (Port Harcourt, Rivers) when he went to inspect the venue of the PDP's rally. The victim claimed that the rally venue was set ablaze and that the assailants were policemen who arrived the venue with police vehicles that were attached to the state governor. The governor denied the claims and accused the supporters of Atiku of spreading propaganda.

ACLED Notes: On 22 December 2022, a Kaduna militia wielding large weapons and in their numbers abducted 10 civilians from Gidan Azara (Kachia, Kaduna). The abductees consisted of four women; three of whom were nursing mothers and six adult males, other sources report 11 abductees. The militiamen rejected a ransom of 5.3 million naira because it was paid in old notes, and instead requested for wine, foodstuff and drugs before releasing two nursing mothers and three men among the abductees.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The abduction or forced disappearance of civilians, without reports of further violence.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 18 December 2022, a Kaduna militia abducted 13 persons from Janjala village in (Kagarko, Kaduna). The abductees comprised of 12 women and one male, there are no reports about ransom demands. The abductors invaded the area through a bush path that borders Kachia LGA. Other sources report that the abductees were 11 and three of the were released around 1 February, there are no reports on ransom payment.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: Around 14 October 2022, (between 13 October - 15 October), Nigerian troops in collaboration with operatives from other security agencies clashed with IPOB militants at a suspected camp of the ESN in Amagunze (Nkanu East, Enugu). The troops dropped explosives, killed an unspecified number of persons and burned houses, civilians in the area fled. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

ACLED Notes: Around 19 December 2022 (as reported), troops of Operation Hadin Kai in collaboration with Civilian JTF ambushed and clashed with Boko Haram [JAS] militants at Ngwom (Mafa, Borno). The militants were moving in a convoy of 20 motorcycles to Sambisa forest and an unspecified number of them were killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: Around 13 November 2022 (between 11 November - 14 November), police forces responded to a distress call and clashed with a Zamfara militia at Dan Sadau (Maru, Zamfara). The militiamen fled with possible gunshot wounds, two rifles, 35 rounds of ammunition and some charms were recovered by the police.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: Around 10 January 2023 (as reported), the troop of Operation Hadarin Daji shot and killed a militia kingpin, Alhaji Shadari, in Sunke forest, Duhuwa, Bagega (Anka, Zamfara). The Nigerian Army had placed a five million naira bounty on him and 16 other wanted militia before he was killed. An unspecified number of his gang members were also killed in the clash. Another source claimed 11 of his gang members were killed in the clash. 11 fatalities reported.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: Around 5 November 2022 (as reported), BNL militants clashed with Nigerian Navy operatives at Ibaka (Mbo, Akwa Ibom). The naval operatives had attempted to stop a boat that was convey the BNL leader and other members of the group.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: Around 15 January 2023 (as reported), an unidentified armed group, numbering about twenty men, shot and killed a security guard as they attacked the INEC office in Oru (Ahiazu Mbaise, Imo). The armed group suspected to be Eastern Security Network (ESN), dressed in the ESN uniform, invaded the INEC office in search of the officers distributing the permanent cards. The assailants were heard shouting, 'No elections in Biafra Land.' 1 fatality reported.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: Around 6 November 2022 (as reported), a member of a local defense militia shot and killed his colleague following a disagreement at Evwreni (Ughelli North, Delta). The assailant fled, other sources report that his mother and son were killed by a mob [coded separately].

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Air or drone strikes that have occurred in the absence of any other engagement; includes any air-to-ground attacks that do not involve exchange of fire with ground forces.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: One-sided violent events in which the tool for engaging in conflict creates asymmetry by taking away the ability of the target to respond.
ACLED Notes: Around 17 January 2023 (as reported), the Nigerian Airforce conducted airstrikes and killed two wanted Boko Haram (JAS) commanders in Kurebe (Shiroro, Niger). The wanted commanders, Abu Ubaida and Mallam Yusuf Abba were killed with about 40 fighters in the air strike. 42 fatalities reported.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Demonstrators engaged in a protest while not engaging in violence or other forms of rioting behavior, and are not faced with any sort of force or engagement.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A protest is defined as a public demonstration in which the participants do not engage in violence, though violence may be used against them.
ACLED Notes: Around 23 February 2023 (as reported), thousands of traders in Oseokwodu market Onitsha (Onisha North, Anambra) protested over claims that the market sanitation levy and stallage fees were embezzled by the former care taker committee chairman. The protesters demanded that the chairman should be made to account and pay back the money. [size=thousands]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Demonstrators engaged in a protest while not engaging in violence or other forms of rioting behavior, and are not faced with any sort of force or engagement.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A protest is defined as a public demonstration in which the participants do not engage in violence, though violence may be used against them.
ACLED Notes: Around 9 January 2023 (weekend of), residents of the Ipav community blocked the Yandev-Ugbema Federal Highway at Ipav (GBoko, Benue), demonstrating against the deplorable state of the road. They accused the federal Government of neglecting the strategic road to their livelihood. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: Around 29 October 2022 (as reported), a mob of over 200 rioters armed with sticks and cutlasses invaded Dan Jamfari community in Barbaji village (Rogo, Kano) and set 10 houses ablaze. The mob who claimed they were in search of their stolen motorcycles stole food stuff and livestock and farming equipment from the residents. [size=over 200]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: Around 20 February 2023, a mob attacked the convoy of the wife of the Borno state governor in the axis of Dalori (Konduga, Borno). Eight vehicles were destroyed. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: Around 6 November 2022 (as reported), a mob killed a woman and her grandson at Evwreni (Ughelli North, Delta) in retaliation for the killing of a local defense militia member by her son [coded separately]. The police claimed that the attack was unrelated to local defense militiamen. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: Around 5 November 2022 (as reported), about 30 members of a Celestial Church of Christ beat up a journalist who went to carry out an investigation at the church in Igbooluwa, Ikorodu (Ikorodu, Lagos). The mob accused the victim of being a thief. [size=about 30]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: Around 9 December 2022 (as reported), a mob of APC supporters attacked and stripped the state chairman of the party naked at the palace of the Emir of Lafia in Lafia (Lafiya, Nassarawa). The reason for the attack is unknown. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: Around 20 November 2022 (as reported), a mob of students killed a fellow student who was accused of stealing a phone in Gwadabawa (Gwadabawa, Sokoto). The student was tied to a pole and tortured in a bid to make him confess, and was confirmed dead at the hospital. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: State forces or other actors exercising de facto control detain a particularly significant individual or engage in mass arrests.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: This event type captures contextually important information regarding the activities of violent groups that is not itself recorded as political violence, yet may trigger future events or contribute to political dynamics within and across states.
ACLED Notes: Around 27 October 2022 (between 20 October - 3 November), the Defense Headquarters claimed 60 suspected illegal miners were arrested by troops who raided an illegal mining site at Tukashara Wasa in Abuja (Abuja Municipal, FCT). Illegally mined items and weapons were also recovered by the troops.

ACLED Notes: Property destruction: Around 21 December 2022 (as reported), suspected PDP supporters destroyed billboards of the APC in Ogoja (Ogaja, Cross River). The police claimed to have arrested an unspecified number of persons who are suspected to have been involved in the vandalization.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: An organized armed group engages in looting or seizing goods or property other than weapons or weapon.

ACLED Notes: Property destruction: Around 26 December 2022 (as reported), SDP loyalists carried out a reprisal attack and damaged a PDP secretariat which was nearby to their secretariat that was invaded in Nonwa Udume (Tai, Rivers).

ACLED Notes: Around 28 October 2022 (as reported), an unidentified armed group shot and killed a pastoralist in Akwukwu-Igbo (Oshimili North, Delta). The assailants also killed three cattle and buried the victim in a shallow grave before they fled. The reason for the attack is unknown, some sources report that a warning was previously issued to pastoralists to flee the area.

ACLED Notes: Around 4 January 2023 (as reported), an unidentified armed group killed two boys and dumped their bodies in a river in Sapele (Sapele, Delta). The victims had been declared missing two days earlier, the reason for the attack is unknown.

ACLED Notes: Around 9 January 2023 (weekend of), an armed group suspected to be from the Aladja Community shot and killed two persons in Ogbe-Ijoh (Warri South, Delta). The attack occurred during the PDP political rally in the community and injured many people. Aladja and Ogbe-Ijoh have engaged in intercommunal crises for about a decade, and the attack risked escalating the tension between the two communities. 2 fatalities reported.

ACLED Notes: Around 26 January 2023 (as reported), suspected armed Fulani pastoralists killed 6 farmers when they invaded and annexed Elerinla (Ose, Ondo), Molege, Ugboruwen, and Adedigba [coded separately]. The assailants uprooted cassava from farms and fed it to their cattle, set houses, cars and motorcycles ablaze, other sources report that at least 8 persons were killed and 40 hectares of farmland were destroyed. Six fatalities split across 2 events coded as 3.
ACLED Source: Blueprint; Daily Independent (Nigeria); Daily Post (Nigeria); Nigeria Punch

At least 12 ISWAP fighters were killed and their weapons were seized. Other sources report that the JAS fighters ambushed ISWAP after a failed negotiation that was initiated by JAS.

ACLED Notes: On 5 December 2022, ISWAP fighters led by Ba'ana Chigori attacked and clashed with Boko Haram [JAS] fighters at their position in Farisu, coded to Gwoza (Gwoza, Borno). 15 JAS fighters including a unit commander Malam Aboubakar also were killed, and seven motorcycles were seized from them.

ACLED Actor1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawati wal-Jihad

ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 24 October 2022, Boko Haram [JAS] fighters from Abu-Iklima's camp carried out reprisals and attacked camps of rival ISWAP fighters and engaged them in an armed clash at Bole and Yale (Konduga, Borno). The Boko Haram fighters killed scores of ISWAP fighters while others fled, recovered weapons, motorcycles, money and other items. ISWAP laid ambush for the Boko Haram fighters as they were returning and killed three of them.

ACLED Actor1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawati wal-Jihad
ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 4 December 2022, Boko Haram fighters divided themselves into two groups and raided ISWAP positions where they engaged them in armed clashes at Arra, Ukuba and Sabil Huda (Gwoza, Borno). More than 23 ISWAP fighters were killed, their weapons, motorcycles and bicycles were seized.

ACLED Actor1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawati wal-Jihad
ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 30 December 2022, a large number of Boko Haram [JAS] fighters led by Abu Umaimah, also known as Bakoura Doro and four other commanders invaded the camp of ISWAP fighters and engaged them in an armed clash at Tumbun Allura and Kangar, coded to Abadam (Abadan, Borno). The clash lasted for 14 hours and entered the following morning, at least 30 fighters from both sides were killed, split across two events and coded as 15. At least four ISWAP prisoners escaped.

ACLED Actor1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawati wal-Jihad
ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 8 January 2023, Boko Haram [JAS] fighters attacked and dislodged ISWAP fighters from their enclaves in the North of Kayowa and Tumbun Gini (Abadan, Borno). Boko Haram killed about 35 ISWAP fighters and seized their major market in Tumbun Gini. Some ammunition and a large cache of weapons were also seized in the clash, which was part of a sustained Boko Haram attack on ISWAP in the Sambisa forest and Lake Chad. 35 fatalities reported.

ACLED Actor2: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawati wal-Jihad

ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 19 November 2022, ISWAP fighters ambushed a convoy of Boko Haram [JAS] fighters and engaged them in an armed clash which lasted about 40 minutes at Chillaria axis of Sambisa Forest Reserve (Gwoza, Borno). An unspecified number of Boko Haram fighters were killed. One Hilux, several motorcycles and weapons were seized by ISWAP. Unknown casualties coded as 3.

The provost, his police orderly, two aides, driver and college librarian were in the same car; the librarian and driver were wounded while the others escaped and were later rescued by policemen. Other cars on the convoy fled back to Isu while the provost's car was looted and burned by the assailants.

He was the brother of a Nollywood actor. The state Commissioner for Solid Mineral was in the car and he was injured with a machete. He was taken to the hospital along with their driver.

ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: On 17 December 2022, a mob attacked the convoy of the APC senatorial candidate for Kano Central at Rimin Kebbe area, coded to Bompai (Nassarawa, Kano). 17 persons sustained minor and major injuries and 17 cars were damaged. The convoy was attacked while they were returning from a condolence visit. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: On 18 January 2023, a mob made up of nine persons burnt a man after he was accused of witchcraft at Tse Agena-Gbamacha, coded to Aliade (Gwer East, Benue). The victim was abducted by the mob and taken to a place where he was tortured in order to force him to confess, he was rescued by the police and taken to a hospital. The leader of the mob was arrested by the police. [size=nine]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: On 16 January 2023, people of the Ewherhe community lynched a man suspected of being an armed robber along the Ewherhe/Ovu road, coded to Agbarho (Ughelli North, Delta). The mas was caught with a locally made cut-to-size double barrel gun, one live cartridge, and some suspected stolen items. The police intervened and took the victim to the hospital, where he died. 1 fatality reported. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: On 12 February 2023, a mob of presumed Hausa people killed a Berom man at Kugya community in Bukuru (Jos South, Plateau) as a reprisal for the murder of their friend who was killed by the victim as a result of a disagreement. The special task force went to the scene to prevent a clash between the two groups. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: A group of individuals that engage in a demonstration involving violence. Examples include vandalism; road-blocking, using barricades, etc.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: On 1 February 2023, rioters demonstrated and marched from Gariki to Enugu (Enugu North, Enugu) over the hike in the price of petroleum products. The rioters manhandled workers at filling stations and forced commercial and private motorists to join the demonstration. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: On 22 October 2022, a mob beat up a woman, stripped her naked and paraded her around in Agunese Affa-Mmaku community, coded to Awgu (Agwu, Enugu). The victim was accused of picking snails from a forbidden forest. [sexual violence] [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: On 4 February 2023, a mob that was suspected to have been politically motivated and affiliated with an APC senator attacked the convoy of the wife of the Adamawa state governor at Muchalla in Mubi North LGA (Adamawa). The rioters threw stones, at the bus convoying the press crew, one person was wounded and the bus was damaged. Other sources report that the wounded victim was a former aide of the senator and the mob insisted that the first lady was not welcome in the area which is the home town of the senator. [size=no report]
ACLED Source: Daily Post (Nigeria); Daily Trust (Nigeria); Sahara Reporters

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Rioters violently interact with other rioters, another armed group or civilians, outside of demonstrations and without the use of lethal weapons.

ACLED Notes: On 4 December 2022, a mob killed a woman at Mughule village in Michika LGA (Adamawa) after she was accused of killing 6 persons using witchcraft. The victim was beat up and set ablaze, four persons were arrested by the police in connection with the attack. [women targeted: accused of witchcraft/sorcery] [size=no report]

ACLED Notes: On 30 January 2023, Nigerian army troops of 9 brigade arrested 116 persons some of who were armed in different parts of Oshodi (Oshodi, Lagos) during a raid. The brigade commander claimed that the arrested persons would be screened and those ascertained to be innocent would be released and the rest, handed over to the police or NDLEA.

The state police command denied that there was an attack in the area.

ACLED Notes: On 5 February 2023, an unidentified armed group suspected to be assassins invaded the house of a PDP chieftain at (Akpabuyo, Cross River) coded to Ikot Nakanda. The chieftain and his family were not at home, the gate keeper was beat up and stabbed multiple times, the assailants who were armed with machetes, sticks and firearms also vandalized properties. The PDP claimed that the APC was responsible for the attack.
ACLED Source: Cross River Watch; Daily Post (Nigeria); Guardian (Nigeria)

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The targeting of civilians with any violence by an organised armed actor. Attacks of sexual nature are coded as ‘Sexual violence’.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 8 December 2022, suspected armed Fulani pastoralists dressed in military uniform along with collaborators from Benue state killed civilians when they attacked Eboh community in Eha Amufu (Isi Uzo, Enugu) after invading the area from neighboring Benue state. Several persons sustained gunshot wounds and seven houses were set ablaze, the victims were mostly children and women, 12 persons were killed, four more bodies were found the following day and other sources report that the fatalities are likely up to 20 as some people were still missing.

ACLED Notes: On 31 January 2023, a suspected Fulani militia attacked and killed a police DPO [presumed to have been off-duty] a few kilometers to Naka town (Gwer West, Benue). Some sources report that the assailants blocked the road for hours before the attack, others report that the victim was going to pick his men that were posted the road on routine duty.
ACLED Source: Daily Independent (Nigeria); Daily Trust (Nigeria); Sahara Reporters

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Demonstrators engaged in a protest while not engaging in violence or other forms of rioting behavior, and are not faced with any sort of force or engagement.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A protest is defined as a public demonstration in which the participants do not engage in violence, though violence may be used against them.
ACLED Notes: Around 9 January 2023 (weekend of), some placard-carrying youths protested the bad state of the Otukpo-Obi-Oju road in Obi LG, coded to Ito (Obi, Benue) and demanded immediate action by the government to fix the road. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: All instances in which an event of ‘Explosions/Remote violence’ is prevented from occurring, or whenever armed actors seize significant caches of weapons.

The ban was placed till further notice, location coded to Gusau (Gusau, Zamfara). The government announced the ban was lifted on 25 October 2022.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.

ACLED Notes: On 11 October 2022, ISWAP fighters ambushed Nigerian troops and Civilian JTF operatives who were on a fighting patrol in Gamboru (Ngala, Borno) and detonated an explosive device. 19 militants were killed and two persons on the side of the troops were wounded in the armed clash which lasted about 40 minutes, 9 motorcycles, multiple weapons and ammunition were recovered.

ACLED Notes: On 6 October 2022, ISWAP fighters ambushed 12 Boko Haram [JAS] fighters and engaged them in an armed clash at Kirinowa (Marte, Borno). The Boko Haram fighters were returning with a large quantity of weapons which they had received from another Boko Haram camp; the ammunition was seized by ISWAP, eight fighters were killed, three others returned to the camp wounded and one was missing or assumed killed.

New air conditioners, some documents, a generating set and furniture were burnt, some of the assailants were wounded before they fled.

Policemen shot live bullets and tear gas at the protesters to disperse them. The police pulled down canopies at the venue of the protest and claimed that the disruption of the protest was 'an order from above'. Other sources report that the policemen clashed with members of a local self defense militia who had earlier given security cover to the protesters. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: A group of individuals that engage in a demonstration involving violence. Examples include vandalism; road-blocking, using barricades, etc.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Riots are violent events where demonstrators or mobs engage in disruptive acts, including but not limited to rock throwing, property destruction, etc.
ACLED Notes: On 4 October 2022, youths burnt tires on the road, disrupted traffic and set 12 to 20 vehicles including trucks carrying petroleum products ablaze while demonstrating in Ughelli (Ughelli North, Delta) against the arrest of suspected internet fraudsters by the EFCC. The demonstrators claimed the suspects were indiscriminately arrested without any evidence, some sources report that between 1 to 3 persons were killed by soldiers who shot at the demonstrators while trying to disperse them, other sources report that the arrest was orchestrated by the ruling party in response to the rally carried out by the youths in support for the Labor Party presidential candidate. The police claimed to have arrested 16 demonstrators. [size=no report]
ACLED Source: Nigeria Punch; Sahara Reporters; Guardian (Nigeria); Vanguard (Nigeria)

The abductees consisted of 8 nursing mothers, four teenage boys and the son of a farmer who resisted the demand of the militiamen to be shown the houses of rich community members, one baby was dropped on the floor while the mother was abducted.

ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 10 October 2022, suspected Fulani pastoralists beat one civilian, killed him and wounded one other person in Jol community (Riyom, Plateau). The wounded person was taken to the hospital, the attack was as a result of a disagreement over grazing.
