ACLED Notes: On 9 October 2022, a Fulani militia killed four civilians when they attacked Batura community (Bokkos, Plateau).

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 9 October 2022, an unidentified armed group numbering six attacked a police station at Inyi (Oji River, Enugu). One on-duty policeman and one civilian who was at the station to lodge a complaint were killed, the police station was set ablaze. Other sources report that the assailants were chanting 'no election and police in Biafra land' and the two fatalities were policemen. IPOB denied responsibility for the attack and accused the Nigerian army of linking the group to the attack out of hatred.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The abduction or forced disappearance of civilians, without reports of further violence.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 11 October 2022, an unidentified armed group abducted an off-duty policeman in Ilorin (Ilorin West, Kwara). The abductee was taken away while he was about to enter his house after the close of work, there are no reports about ransom demands. The abductee was rescued by policemen, hunters and a local self defense militia on 16 October, there are no reports of a clash.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The abduction or forced disappearance of civilians, without reports of further violence.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 8 October 2022, an unidentified armed group numbering 10 and dressed in military camouflage abducted four farmers at the agric settlement in Iseyin (Iseyin, Oyo). The persons who escaped the abduction fled towards Okeho, security operatives conducted a search and rescue operation in the area. The body of one of the abductees was found on 10 October. The abductees were released on 14 October after 10 million naira was paid as ransom.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The targeting of civilians with any violence by an organised armed actor. Attacks of sexual nature are coded as ‘Sexual violence’.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 11 October 2022, an unidentified armed group shot a commercial driver on the foot and hijacked his bus with passengers in it at the Omerelu axis (Emohua, Rivers). The driver was rescued and taken to a hospital while the passengers were abducted, the victims were en route Port Harcourt from Owerri.

ACLED Notes: On 13 October 2022, suspected Fulani pastoralists invaded Obeagu community (Agwu, Ebonyi) and left two persons seriously injured. An unspecified number of persons were abducted by the assailants who laid siege on the road and attacked residents returning to the community from the town. Other sources report one killed and two others abducted.

The troops repelled the attack and killed about two dozens of militants, some others fled with gunshot wounds; a few soldiers were wounded and one patrol vehicle was destroyed.

The assailants also attacked the task force with other weapons, casualties are unknown.

ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 5 October 2022, an unidentified armed group comprised of pastoralists killed a soldier who responded to a distress call in Gagiya community Guri LGA (Jigawa). The assailants encroached into a farmland and the killed soldier who tried to prevent a fight between pastoralists and farmers; he was shot with a bow and arrow after with he was cut with a machete his rifle was stolen by the assailants.

ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 12 October 2022, an unidentified armed group attacked an operative of the police So Safe corps with a machete and wounded him at Anifowose community (Ifo, Ogun). The operatives had trailed the assailants who 10 in number when they stopped and attacked one operative. One motorcycle and a locally made gun were recovered by the operatives while the assailants fled.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 9 October 2022, an unidentified armed group dressed in military camouflage attacked policemen who were on a stop and search duty at Umuna, coded to Okigwi (Okigwe, Imo). Two policemen were killed, one was wounded by the assailants who drove army Hilux vehicles.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 12 October 2022, policemen responded to a distress call and clashed with a Katsina militia at Gidan Baushe, Gatakawa (Kankara, Katsina). 18 persons that the assailants abducted were rescued, 5 motorcycles and 2 cows were recovered; many militiamen were assumed killed while others fled with bullet wounds. Two civilians were killed and one was wounded before the arrival of the police, unknown fatalities coded as 3.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: On 3 October 2022, a local self defense militia clashed with an unidentified armed group at Dogoruwa in Bali LGA (Taraba) and killed 12 of them. The armed group was chased from neighboring Gassol LGA. Other sources report that an unidentified armed group dressed up as a local defense militia; killed 12 civilians at Mubizen, rustled 130 cattle, stole several motorcycles and food supplies; four of the assailants were arrested by the police and 8 to 50 other residents were declared missing.
ACLED Source: Sahara Reporters; Guardian (Nigeria); Daily Post (Nigeria); Premium Times (Nigeria)

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.

ACLED Notes: On 1 October 2022, a local self defense that tried to foil an abduction clashed with a Niger militia at Ajiji-Kapako (Lapai, Niger). The assailants wounded one member of the defense militia and abducted three farmers.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Air or drone strikes that have occurred in the absence of any other engagement; includes any air-to-ground attacks that do not involve exchange of fire with ground forces.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: One-sided violent events in which the tool for engaging in conflict creates asymmetry by taking away the ability of the target to respond.
ACLED Notes: On 8 October 2022, the Nigerian military claimed to have conducted an airstrike against a Kaduna militia who were converging under tree covers for a meeting at a location 33km northwest of Mando (Birnin Gwari, Kaduna). Several militiamen including militia leaders and their followers were killed, coded as 3.
ACLED Source: Premium Times (Nigeria); Blueprint; Daily Leadership (Nigeria); BBC News

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Air or drone strikes that have occurred in the absence of any other engagement; includes any air-to-ground attacks that do not involve exchange of fire with ground forces.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: One-sided violent events in which the tool for engaging in conflict creates asymmetry by taking away the ability of the target to respond.
ACLED Notes: On 8 October 2022, the Nigerian military claimed that the air component of Operation Whirl Punch carried out an airstrike that was targeted at a Niger militia leader called Ali Dogo a.k.a Yellow and his fighters, at Yadi in Giwa LGA (Kaduna). The militiamen were meeting at the house of Alhaji Gwarzo, after they fled from Niger state; all the persons who were in the building were killed, including Yellow and 30 others.
ACLED Source: Daily Leadership (Nigeria); Blueprint; Premium Times (Nigeria); BBC News

ACLED Notes: On 4 October 2022, residents of Umuchichi and Umueme communities in Obioma Ngwa LGA (Abia) coded to Mgboko, protested over the current state of the major roads within the areas and demanded that the two companies doing business in the area fix the road. [size=no report]

The protesters demanded that the electricity company should disconnect them from the Ilesa electricity supply which they described as the cause of the current poor supply in the community. [size=no report]

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The targeting of civilians with any violence by an organised armed actor. Attacks of sexual nature are coded as ‘Sexual violence’.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 12 October 2022, an suspected Fulani pastoralists attacked farmers who were working on their farms and killed 5 of them at Yelwata community, coded to Gbajimba (Guma, Benue). 4 to 6 other victims sustained varying degrees of machete inflicted wounds.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The targeting of civilians with any violence by an organised armed actor. Attacks of sexual nature are coded as ‘Sexual violence’.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 8 October 2022, a presumed Katsina militia attacked civilians traveling along Funtua-Gusau road (Funtua, Katsina), shot one person and abducted another. The wounded victim later died in the hospital.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The targeting of civilians with any violence by an organised armed actor. Attacks of sexual nature are coded as ‘Sexual violence’.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 8 October 2022, suspected armed Fulani pastoralists attacked civilians and killed at least 10 persons at Gidan Sule in Keana LGA (Nassarawa). The assailants shot sporadically, killed 5 people on the spot, while 5 other bodies were discovered the following day; scores of persons escaped with gunshot wounds, several others including women, children and old persons were missing.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The targeting of civilians with any violence by an organised armed actor. Attacks of sexual nature are coded as ‘Sexual violence’.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 5 October 2022, a Zamfara militia attacked and shot sporadically at residents of Birnin Waje coded to Bukuyum (Bukkuyum, Zamfara). 26 to 38 residents including women and children drowned as they were fleeing in canoes from the assailants who shot at them while they were in the canoes.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The abduction or forced disappearance of civilians, without reports of further violence.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: On 7 October 2022, a Niger militia abducted 16 farmers while they were working on their farms at Kache village in Lapai LGA (Niger). Four of the abductees escaped from the abductors' camp, a ransom of 16 million naira was demanded for the remaining abductees. Other sources report that 15 abductees were released after 16 million naira and some foodstuff was paid as ransom, one of the abductees was murdered when he attempted to escaped.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: Around 6 October 2022 (as reported), the Defense Headquarters claimed to have raided a hideout and clashed with an unidentified armed group in Awe LGA (Nassarawa). Two members of the armed group were killed; guns, one motorcycle and mobile phones were recovered.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: Armed, organized groups engage in a battle, and no reports indicate a change in territorial control.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: A violent interaction between two politically organized armed groups at a particular time and location.
ACLED Notes: Around 6 October 2022 (as reported), the Defense Headquarters claimed that soldiers responded to a distress call and clashed with a Benue militia at Zaki Biam and Zamkara (Ukum, Benue). Three militiamen were arrested, two guns, ammunition, two phones and one motorcycle were recovered.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The targeting of civilians with any violence by an organised armed actor. Attacks of sexual nature are coded as ‘Sexual violence’.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: Around 8 October 2022 (as reported), an unidentified armed group killed a man from Kwanar Dangora village and left the body in Bebeji LGA (Kano). The man had been abducted on 2 October 2022 (coded separately) and killed after a ransom was paid.

ACLED Event SubTypeDesc: The targeting of civilians with any violence by an organised armed actor. Attacks of sexual nature are coded as ‘Sexual violence’.
ACLED Event TypeDesc: Violence against unarmed civilians is categorized as Violence against civilians.
ACLED Notes: Around 7 October 2022 (as reported), an unidentified armed group killed a man whom they abducted on 2 October [coded separately]. The victim's body was found at Badafi ward (Kiru, Kano). The abductors collected a ransom of 1.030 million naira before informing the victim's relatives that he had been killed.
